get.summary: Cancels an update on the specified stack.
get.description: Cancels an update on the specified stack.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack.

get.summary: For a specified stack that is in the UPDATE_ROLLBACK_FAILED state, continues rolling it backn         to the UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE state.
get.description: For a specified stack that is in the UPDATE_ROLLBACK_FAILED state, continues rolling it back         to the UPDATE_ROLLBACK_COMPLETE state.

parameters.name: ResourcesToSkip.member.N
parameters.description: A list of the logical IDs of the resources that AWS CloudFormation skips during the continue update rollback operation.         You can specify only resources that are in the UPDATE_FAILED state because a        rollback failed.         You cant specify resources that are in the UPDATE_FAILED state for other        reasons, for example, because an update was canceled.         To check why a resource update failed, use the DescribeStackResources        action, and view the resource status reason.

parameters.name: RoleARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS CloudFormation         assumes to roll back the stack. AWS CloudFormation uses the roles credentials to make calls on your behalf.         AWS CloudFormation always uses this role for all future operations on the stack.         As long as users have permission to operate on the stack, AWS CloudFormation uses this role even         if the users dont have permission to pass it. Ensure that the role grants least privilege.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique ID of the stack that you want to continue rolling back.

get.summary: Creates a list of changes for a stack.
get.description: Creates a list of changes for a stack.

parameters.name: Capabilities.member.N
parameters.description: A list of values that you must specify before AWS CloudFormation can update certain stacks. Some stack templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your AWS account, for example, by creating new AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users. For those stacks, you must explicitly acknowledge their capabilities by specifying this parameter.

parameters.name: ChangeSetName
parameters.description: The name of the change set. The name must be unique among all change sets that are associated with the specified stack.

parameters.name: ChangeSetType
parameters.description: The type of change set operation. To create a change set for a new stack, specify CREATE.         To create a change set for an existing stack, specify UPDATE.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique identifier for this CreateChangeSet request. Specify this token if you plan to retry requests so that AWS CloudFormation knows that youre not          attempting to create another change set with the same name. You might retry CreateChangeSet requests to ensure that AWS CloudFormation successfully received them.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: A description to help you identify this change set.

parameters.name: NotificationARNs.member.N
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topics that AWS CloudFormation associates with the stack. To remove all associated notification topics, specify an empty list.

parameters.name: Parameters.member.N
parameters.description: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the change set. For more information, see the          Parameter data type.

parameters.name: ResourceTypes.member.N
parameters.description: The template resource types that you have permissions to work with if you execute this change set, such as AWS::EC2::Instance, AWS::EC2::*, or Custom::MyCustomInstance.

parameters.name: RoleARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS CloudFormation         assumes when executing the change set. AWS CloudFormation uses the roles credentials to make calls on your behalf.         AWS CloudFormation uses this role for all future operations on the stack.         As long as users have permission to operate on the stack, AWS CloudFormation uses this role even         if the users dont have permission to pass it. Ensure that the role grants least privilege.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique ID of the stack for which you are creating a change set. AWS CloudFormation generates the change set by comparing this stacks information with the information that you submit, such as a modified template or different parameter input values.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to associate with this stack. AWS CloudFormation also propagates these tags to resources in the stack. You can specify a maximum of 10 tags.

parameters.name: TemplateBody
parameters.description: A structure that contains the body of the revised template, with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. AWS CloudFormation generates the change set by comparing this template with the template of the stack that you specified.

parameters.name: TemplateURL
parameters.description: The location of the file that contains the revised template. The URL must point to a template (max size: 460,800 bytes) that is located in an S3 bucket. AWS CloudFormation generates the change set by comparing this template with the stack that you specified.

parameters.name: UsePreviousTemplate
parameters.description: Whether to reuse the template that is associated with the stack to create the change set.

get.summary: Creates a stack as specified in the template.
get.description: Creates a stack as specified in the template.

parameters.name: Capabilities.member.N
parameters.description: A list of values that you must specify before AWS CloudFormation can create certain stacks. Some stack templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your AWS account, for example, by creating new AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users. For those stacks, you must explicitly acknowledge their capabilities by specifying this parameter.

parameters.name: DisableRollback
parameters.description: Set to true to disable rollback of the stack if stack creation failed. You can specify either      DisableRollback or OnFailure, but not both.

parameters.name: NotificationARNs.member.N
parameters.description: The Simple Notification Service (SNS) topic ARNs to publish stack related events. You can find your SNS topic         ARNs using the SNS console or your Command Line Interface         (CLI).

parameters.name: OnFailure
parameters.description: Determines what action will be taken if stack creation fails. This must be one of: DO_NOTHING, ROLLBACK, or      DELETE. You can specify either OnFailure or DisableRollback, but not both.

parameters.name: Parameters.member.N
parameters.description: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack. For more information, see the          Parameter data type.

parameters.name: ResourceTypes.member.N
parameters.description: The template resource types that you have permissions to work with for this create stack action, such as AWS::EC2::Instance, AWS::EC2::*, or Custom::MyCustomInstance. Use the following syntax to describe template resource types:         AWS::* (for all AWS resource), Custom::* (for all custom resources), Custom::logical_ID                   (for a specific custom resource), AWS::service_name::* (for all resources of a particular AWS service), and AWS::service_name::resource_logical_ID                   (for a specific AWS resource).

parameters.name: RoleARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS CloudFormation         assumes to create the stack. AWS CloudFormation uses the roles credentials to make calls on your behalf.         AWS CloudFormation always uses this role for all future operations on the stack.         As long as users have permission to operate on the stack, AWS CloudFormation uses this role even         if the users dont have permission to pass it. Ensure that the role grants least privilege.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name that is associated with the stack. The name must be unique in the region in which you are creating the stack.

parameters.name: StackPolicyBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go to          Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.      You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: StackPolicyURL
parameters.description: Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy        (maximum        size: 16 KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack.      You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to associate with this stack. AWS CloudFormation also propagates these tags to the resources created in the stack. A maximum number of 10 tags can be specified.

parameters.name: TemplateBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information, go to Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: TemplateURL
parameters.description: Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size: 460,800 bytes)         that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, go to the Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: TimeoutInMinutes
parameters.description: The amount of time that can pass before the stack status becomes CREATE_FAILED; if DisableRollback         is not set or is set to false, the stack will be rolled back.

get.summary: Deletes the specified change set.
get.description: Deletes the specified change set.

parameters.name: ChangeSetName
parameters.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the change set that you want to delete.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: If you specified the name of a change set to delete, specify the stack name or ID (ARN) that is associated with it.

get.summary: Deletes a specified stack.
get.description: Deletes a specified stack.

parameters.name: RetainResources.member.N
parameters.description: For stacks in the DELETE_FAILED state, a list of resource logical IDs that are associated with          the resources you want to retain. During deletion, AWS CloudFormation deletes the stack but does not delete         the retained resources.

parameters.name: RoleARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS CloudFormation         assumes to delete the stack. AWS CloudFormation uses the roles credentials to make calls on your behalf.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack.

get.summary: Retrieves your account's AWS CloudFormation limits, such as the maximum number of stacks that you can create in your account.
get.description: Retrieves your accounts AWS CloudFormation limits, such as the maximum number of stacks that you can create in your account.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string that identifies the next page of limits that you want to retrieve.

get.summary: Returns the inputs for the change set and a list of changes that AWS CloudFormation will make if you execute the change set.
get.description: Returns the inputs for the change set and a list of changes that AWS CloudFormation will make if you execute the change set.

parameters.name: ChangeSetName
parameters.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the change set that you want to describe.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string (provided by the DescribeChangeSet response output) that identifies the next page of information that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: If you specified the name of a change set, specify the stack name or ID (ARN) of the change set you want to describe.

get.summary: Returns all stack related events for a specified stack in reverse chronological order.
get.description: Returns all stack related events for a specified stack in reverse chronological order.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string that identifies the next page of events that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

get.summary: Returns a description of the specified resource in the specified stack.
get.description: Returns a description of the specified resource in the specified stack.

parameters.name: LogicalResourceId
parameters.description: The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

get.summary: Returns AWS resource descriptions for running and deleted stacks.
get.description: Returns AWS resource descriptions for running and deleted stacks.

parameters.name: LogicalResourceId
parameters.description: The logical name of the resource as specified in the template.

parameters.name: PhysicalResourceId
parameters.description: The name or unique identifier that corresponds to a physical instance ID of a resource supported by AWS CloudFormation.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

get.summary: Returns the description for the specified stack; if no stack name was specified, then it returns the description for all the stacks created.
get.description: Returns the description for the specified stack; if no stack name was specified, then it returns the description for all the stacks created.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

get.summary: Returns the estimated monthly cost of a template.
get.description: Returns the estimated monthly cost of a template.

parameters.name: Parameters.member.N
parameters.description: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters.

parameters.name: TemplateBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy         in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

parameters.name: TemplateURL
parameters.description: Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, go to Template Anatomy         in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

get.summary: Updates a stack using the input information that was provided when the specified change set was created.
get.description: Updates a stack using the input information that was provided when the specified change set was created.

parameters.name: ChangeSetName
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the change set that you want use to update the specified stack.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: If you specified the name of a change set, specify the stack name or ID (ARN) that is associated with the change set you want to execute.

get.summary: Returns the stack policy for a specified stack.
get.description: Returns the stack policy for a specified stack.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or unique stack ID that is associated with the stack whose policy you want to get.

get.summary: Returns the template body for a specified stack.
get.description: Returns the template body for a specified stack.

parameters.name: ChangeSetName
parameters.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a change set for which AWS CloudFormation returns the associated template.         If you specify a name, you must also specify the StackName.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

parameters.name: TemplateStage
parameters.description: For templates that include transforms, the stage of the template that AWS CloudFormation returns.         To get the user-submitted template, specify Original. To get the template after         AWS CloudFormation has processed all transforms, specify Processed.

get.summary: Returns information about a new or existing template.
get.description: Returns information about a new or existing template.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable. For running stacks, you can specify either the stacks name or its unique stack ID. For deleted stack, you must specify the unique stack ID.

parameters.name: TemplateBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information about templates, see Template Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: TemplateURL
parameters.description: Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size:         460,800 bytes) that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information about templates, see Template            Anatomy in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

get.summary: Returns the ID and status of each active change set for a stack.
get.description: Returns the ID and status of each active change set for a stack.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string (provided by the ListChangeSets response output) that identifies the next page of change sets that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the stack for which you want to list change sets.

get.summary: Lists all exported output values in the account and region in which you call this action.
get.description: Lists all exported output values in the account and region in which you call this action.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string (provided by the ListExports response output) that        identifies the next page of exported output values that you asked to retrieve.

get.summary: Lists all stacks that are importing an exported output value.
get.description: Lists all stacks that are importing an exported output value.

parameters.name: ExportName
parameters.description: The name of the exported output value. AWS CloudFormation returns the         stack names that are importing this value.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string (provided by the ListImports response output) that         identifies the next page of stacks that are importing the specified exported output value.

get.summary: Returns descriptions of all resources of the specified stack.
get.description: Returns descriptions of all resources of the specified stack.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string that identifies the next page of stack resources that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or the unique stack ID that is associated with the stack, which are not always interchangeable:

get.summary: Returns the summary information for stacks whose status matches the specified StackStatusFilter.
get.description: Returns the summary information for stacks whose status matches the specified StackStatusFilter.

parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.description: A string that identifies the next page of stacks that you want to retrieve.

parameters.name: StackStatusFilter.member.N
parameters.description: Stack status to use as a filter. Specify one or more stack status codes to list only stacks with the specified         status codes. For a complete list of stack status codes, see the StackStatus parameter of the            Stack data type.

get.summary: Sets a stack policy for a specified stack.
get.description: Sets a stack policy for a specified stack.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or unique stack ID that you want to associate a policy with.

parameters.name: StackPolicyBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the stack policy body. For more information, go to          Prevent Updates to Stack Resources in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.         You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: StackPolicyURL
parameters.description: Location of a file containing the stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (maximum size: 16 KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack.      You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

get.summary: Sends a signal to the specified resource with a success or failure status.
get.description: Sends a signal to the specified resource with a success or failure status.

parameters.name: LogicalResourceId
parameters.description: The logical ID of the resource that you want to signal. The logical ID is the name of the resource that given in the template.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The stack name or unique stack ID that includes the resource that you want to signal.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the signal, which is either success or failure. A failure signal causes AWS CloudFormation to immediately fail the stack creation or update.

parameters.name: UniqueId
parameters.description: A unique ID of the signal. When you signal Amazon EC2 instances or Auto Scaling groups, specify the instance ID that you are signaling as the unique ID. If you send multiple signals to a single resource (such as signaling a wait condition), each signal requires a different unique ID.

get.summary: Updates a stack as specified in the template.
get.description: Updates a stack as specified in the template.

parameters.name: Capabilities.member.N
parameters.description: A list of values that you must specify before AWS CloudFormation can update certain stacks. Some stack templates might include resources that can affect permissions in your AWS account, for example, by creating new AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) users. For those stacks, you must explicitly acknowledge their capabilities by specifying this parameter.

parameters.name: NotificationARNs.member.N
parameters.description: Amazon Simple Notification Service topic Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) that AWS CloudFormation associates with the stack. Specify an empty list to remove all notification topics.

parameters.name: Parameters.member.N
parameters.description: A list of Parameter structures that specify input parameters for the stack. For more information, see the          Parameter data type.

parameters.name: ResourceTypes.member.N
parameters.description: The template resource types that you have permissions to work with for this update stack action, such as AWS::EC2::Instance, AWS::EC2::*, or Custom::MyCustomInstance.

parameters.name: RoleARN
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that AWS CloudFormation         assumes to update the stack. AWS CloudFormation uses the roles credentials to make calls on your behalf.         AWS CloudFormation always uses this role for all future operations on the stack.         As long as users have permission to operate on the stack, AWS CloudFormation uses this role even         if the users dont have permission to pass it. Ensure that the role grants least privilege.

parameters.name: StackName
parameters.description: The name or unique stack ID of the stack to update.

parameters.name: StackPolicyBody
parameters.description: Structure containing a new stack policy body. You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the temporary overriding stack policy body. You can specify either the StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody or the StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL
parameters.description: Location of a file containing the temporary overriding stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack.         You can specify either the StackPolicyDuringUpdateBody or the StackPolicyDuringUpdateURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: StackPolicyURL
parameters.description: Location of a file containing the updated stack policy. The URL must point to a policy (max size: 16KB) located in an S3 bucket in the same region as the stack.         You can specify either the StackPolicyBody or the StackPolicyURL parameter, but not both.

parameters.name: Tags.member.N
parameters.description: Key-value pairs to associate with this stack. AWS CloudFormation also propagates these tags to supported resources in the stack. You can specify a maximum number of 10 tags.

parameters.name: TemplateBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. (For more information, go to Template Anatomy         in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.)

parameters.name: TemplateURL
parameters.description: Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, go to Template Anatomy         in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: UsePreviousTemplate
parameters.description: Reuse the existing template that is associated with the stack that you are updating.

get.summary: Validates a specified template.
get.description: Validates a specified template.

parameters.name: TemplateBody
parameters.description: Structure containing the template body with a minimum length of 1 byte and a maximum length of 51,200 bytes. For more information, go to Template Anatomy         in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.

parameters.name: TemplateURL
parameters.description: Location of file containing the template body. The URL must point to a template (max size: 460,800 bytes)         that is located in an Amazon S3 bucket. For more information, go to Template Anatomy         in the AWS CloudFormation User Guide.
